definition[0]: to not know what to say or do because you feel confused or upset
example[0]: I found myself floundering as I tried to answer her questions.
definition[1]: to have a lot of problems and be likely to fail completely
example[2]: More and more firms are floundering because of the recession.
definition[2]: to be unable to move easily because you are in deep water or mud, or cannot see very well
example[3]: They were floundering chest-deep in the freezing water.
example[4]: I could hear them floundering around in the dark.
definition[3]: a type of small fish that you can eat
